ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The supported_item allows for the designation of an , an , or an .
This specifies the use of an .

An action is the identification of the occurrence of an activity and a description of its result.
An action identifies an activity that has taken place, is taking place, or is expected to take place in the future.
An action has a definition that is specified by an .
In particular application domains, terms such as task, process, activity, operation, and event may be synonyms for action.
Change, distilling, design, a process to drill a hole, and a task such as training someone are examples of actions.

the
by which the action is known.

the
that characterizes the action. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

the
that specifies the procedure selected to carry out the action and a description of the results of that action.

ext_description.note: This attribute is an enhancement to the definition of action using a method that is upwardly compatible with ISO 10303-41:1994.

The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
Each action shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An action_directive is an authoritative instrument that provides directions to achieve the specified results.
ISO Directives Part 3 provides guidance for the development of standards documents within ISO.

ext_description.p: an informal description of the results of the analysis that was carried out on the elements of the requests set. The request sets are the s referenced in the requests attribute.
ext_description.note: The reason that different requests are satisfied by the action_directive could be recorded in this attribute.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an informal description of any other pertinent information.

the
that characterizes the action_directive. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

the
by which the action_directive is known.

a set of
entity data types that defines the expected results.

An action_method is the definition of an activity. This definition includes the activityâ€™s objectives and effects.
This definition may be the basis for actions or the solution for action requests.
For the
whose name attribute is 'serve dinner', the name attribute of related instance of action_method could be 'cook by recipe' or 'purchase takeout food'.

the
by which the action_method is known.

the
that characterizes the action_method. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
an informal description of the effects of the action_method.
an informal description of the objectives of the action_method.

An action_method_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of this relationship.
The role of action_method_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.
This entity may be used to define a procedural relationship among constituent activities.

the
by which the action_method_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the action_method_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An action_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of this relationship.
The role of action_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

the
by which the action_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the action_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An action_request_solution is an association between a
and an
that is a potential solution for the request.

the
that is a potential solution.

the
for which a solution is specified.

ext_description.note: This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to action_request_solution as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the action_request_solution is known.
ext_description.note: This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to action_request_solution as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

ext_description.p:
Each action_request_solution shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.

ext_description.p:
Each action_request_solution shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An action_request_status is the association of a status with a .

the
to which the status applies.

ext_description.p:
the
that provides a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the action.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An action_resource is a thing that is identified as being needed to carry out an action.

the
that characterizes the action_resource. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

the
that specifies the sort of action_resource that is being used.

the
by which the action_resource is known.
a set of s for which the action_resource is used.

An action_resource_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of this relationship.
The role of action_resource_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

the
that characterizes the action_resource_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

the
by which the action_resource_relationship is known.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An action_resource_type is the identification of the kind of
needed to carry out an action.
This entity may be used to specify the kind of tool needed to perform a process operation.

the
by which the action_resource_type is known.

An action_status is the association of a status with an .
Information about the date and time may be associated with the action_status through the use of , , or .

the
to which the status applies.

ext_description.p:
the
that provides a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the action.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example: Terms such as 'pending', 'completed', or 'scheduled' are examples of status.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A directed_action is a type of
that is governed by an .
A directed_action could be the inspection of a building as directed by city officials according to the city building codes for earthquake safety. The action is the inspection of the building. The directive is issued by city officials guided by the city building codes. In an application protocol, the building authority may be associated with an . The building codes may be associated with a .

the
that governs the directed_action.

An executed_action is a type of
that is either completed, partially completed or just identified. It may but need not have status information associated with it.
The role of executed_action can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Status information is associated to executed_action through .
An executed_action could be to 'paint the office' with a status of 'scheduled'. The action is 'paint the office'. The status further qualifies the action as 'planned', 'scheduled', or 'completed'.

A versioned_action_request is a specification of a desired result.
The desired result being identified and described may be obtained through one of more s.

ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of the version of the versioned_action_request.
an informal description of the reason for the versioned_action_request.

the
that characterizes the versioned_action_request. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

A versioned_action_request_relationship is a relationship between two
objects.
Two
objects may be related if they address similar problems.
A
may be a version of a work request. It might be related to a different version of the work request using a versioned_action_request_relationship.

the
that distinguishes the versioned_action_request_relationship.

the
by which the versioned_action_request_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the versioned_action_request_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The acyclic_action_method_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.

The acyclic_action_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
for which the function is searching in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.

The acyclic_action_resource_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.

The acyclic_versioned_action_request_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either an
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.
